title: Kathryn the Ice Queen
data:
**Kathryn the Ice Queen**, @, is the boss of the [Ice Queen's Realm](/wiki/Ice_Queen%27s_Realm "Ice Queen's Realm") in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"). She is a powerful [human](/wiki/Human "Human") sorceress under an evil curse - upon her defeat, the curse is lifted and she becomes the much more powerful and peaceful **Kathryn the Enchantress**, @. She is unaligned in her Ice Queen form and [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful") in her Enchantress form, and is completely unkillable: she cannot be [tamed](/wiki/Tame "Tame"), [genocided](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide"), or [polymorphed](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") into in either form.

## Descriptions

[x][ ]

- Kathryn the Ice Queen
- Kathryn the Enchantress

|                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                   |

| Kathryn the Ice Queen:* can [fly](/wiki/Fly "Fly").
* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* [regenerates HP quickly](/wiki/Regeneration "Regeneration").
* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is female.
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* is [nasty](/wiki/M2_NASTY "M2 NASTY").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* [likes gold](/wiki/Gold_lover "Gold lover").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can pick up [magical items](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item").
* has [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* [never leaves a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless"). |                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        | [EvilHack 0.8.3 - monst.c, line 3302](https://github.com/k21971/EvilHack/blob/v0.8.3/src/monst.c#L3302)                                                                           |

Kathryn the Ice Queen is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong") and possesses enhanced [regeneration](/wiki/Regeneration "Regeneration"), [flight](/wiki/Flight "Flight"), [teleport control](/wiki/Teleport_control "Teleport control"), [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"), and the ability to [see invisible](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible"). She will also seek out [magical items](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item") and other objects to pick up.

Kathryn the Ice Queen has a weapon attack, a powerful [cold](/wiki/Cold "Cold") touch attack, and casts one clerical and one mage [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell") during each of her turns. She is capable of casting spells without cooldown, and will never cast the [fire bolt](/wiki/Fire_bolt "Fire bolt"), [fire pillar](/wiki/Fire_pillar "Fire pillar") or [summon insects](/wiki/Summon_insects "Summon insects") spells, instead using [ice bolt](/wiki/Ice_bolt "Ice bolt"), [lightning](/wiki/Lightning_\(monster_spell\) "Lightning (monster spell)") and [vulnerability](/wiki/Vulnerability_\(monster_spell\) "Vulnerability (monster spell)") respectively. Kathryn is more likely to weaken a character's cold resistance with the vulnerability spell; her [geyser](/wiki/Geyser "Geyser") spell deals cold damage and can destroy [potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion") in the open inventory; and she will also use the [summon minion](/wiki/Summon_minion "Summon minion") spell to create hostile [snow golems](/wiki/Snow_golem "Snow golem").

Kathryn possesses [stoning resistance](/wiki/Stoning_resistance "Stoning resistance"), [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance") and [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance"), and is [vulnerable](/wiki/Vulnerable "Vulnerable") to [fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire").

### Generation

Kathryn the Ice Queen is always found inside her castle on the third and final floor of the branch, and resides within the left inner chambers. She will always generate hostile, and is guarded by [Bourbon](/wiki/Bourbon "Bourbon") and [Ozzy](/wiki/Ozzy "Ozzy"); they generate peaceful, but will become hostile and protect her once she is attacked.

Kathryn the Ice Queen is [always generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") an enchanted, [erosion](/wiki/Erosion "Erosion")-proofed [athame](/wiki/Athame "Athame") of frost, a [pair of gloves](/wiki/Pair_of_gloves "Pair of gloves"), a pair of [high boots](/wiki/High_boots "High boots"), an [amulet of reflection](/wiki/Amulet_of_reflection "Amulet of reflection"), a [ring of slow digestion](/wiki/Ring_of_slow_digestion "Ring of slow digestion"), and one of either a [cloak of magic resistance](/wiki/Cloak_of_magic_resistance "Cloak of magic resistance") or a [cloak of displacement](/wiki/Cloak_of_displacement "Cloak of displacement"). If generated on her birthday, she will generate with roughly 4 times her usual HP and a [potion of full healing](/wiki/Potion_of_full_healing "Potion of full healing").

### Strategy

In addition to ascension-level gear, the Ice Queen has the full range of monster spells to cast at her disposal, with her spellcasting geared towards a cold-based offense; this includes using the vulnerability spell to weaken resistance to cold in particular. In short, cold resistance is especially important here (as well as for the branch overall), along with [acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance") to blunt the worst damage from her acid blast spells; weakened cold resistance will cause the characters HP to slowly deplete, so unless they are capable of passively out-healing the frost damage, it is best to defeat her quickly. Defeating Kathryn will transform her into her Enchantress form, also pacifying Bourbon and Ozzy if they are still hostile.

One of the quickest means of defeating Kathryn the Ice Queen is to use [poisoned](/wiki/Poisoned "Poisoned") weapons and poison-damaging spells, since she lacks poison resistance. Unless a means to pacify her afterward is available (discussed in the other tab), **do not use a [scroll of stinking cloud](/wiki/Scroll_of_stinking_cloud "Scroll of stinking cloud")** for this purpose: this will anger her if the [poison clouds](/wiki/Poison_cloud "Poison cloud") defeat her and return her to Enchantress form well before they dissipate. Her weakness to fire can also be exploited by using several blessed [fire](/wiki/Scroll_of_fire "Scroll of fire") scrolls or a Skilled-level [fireball](/wiki/Fireball "Fireball") spell.

|                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                 |

| **[Alignment](/wiki/Alignment#Monster_alignment "Alignment")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 | 15 (lawful)                                                                                                                                     |

| **[Genocidable](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   | No                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                 |
| **[Weight](/wiki/Weight "Weight")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            | 1450                                                                                                                                            |

| **[Size](/wiki/Physical_size "Physical size")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | Medium                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                 |
| **[Resistances](/wiki/Resistance "Resistance")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               | petrification, sleep, cold, fire, electricity, poison, acid, disintegration, psychic                                                            |
| **Resistances [conveyed](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              | None                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                 |
| Kathryn the Enchantress:* can [fly](/wiki/Fly "Fly").
* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* [regenerates HP quickly](/wiki/Regeneration "Regeneration").
* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is female.
* is normally generated [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful").
* is [nasty](/wiki/M2_NASTY "M2 NASTY").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* [likes gold](/wiki/Gold_lover "Gold lover").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can pick up [magical items](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item").
* lets you close unless attacked.
* has [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* [never leaves a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless"). |                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                 |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               | [EvilHack 0.8.3 - monst.c, line 3315](https://github.com/k21971/EvilHack/blob/v0.8.3/src/monst.c#L3315)                                         |

Kathryn the Enchantress has the same qualities as she does in her previous form, and additionally possesses [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance"), [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance"), [acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance"), [shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance"), [disintegration resistance](/wiki/Disintegration_resistance "Disintegration resistance"), and [psychic resistance](/index.php?title=Psychic_resistance\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Psychic resistance (page does not exist)").

Kathryn the Enchantress has a powerful weapon attack, and casts a powerful clerical [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell") and a powerful mage monster spell during each of her turns.

### Generation

Kathryn the Enchantress always appears after her Ice Queen form is defeated, and will be generated peaceful unless the character is an [Infidel](/wiki/Infidel "Infidel"). She retains whatever inventory she still possesses from her previous form.

### Strategy

In this form, Kathryn has almost every resistance available in the game, alongside attacks and spells that can easily cleave through most of an ascension-worthy character's [full healing](/wiki/Potion_of_full_healing "Potion of full healing")-and-[nurse dance](/wiki/Nurse_dance "Nurse dance")-bolstered HP. As such, she is orders of magnitude more difficult than any other monster in the game, and is very difficult to defeat in normal play, immediately resurrecting at full HP if defeated: there is no benefit to attacking her, outside of bragging rights. If Kathryn the Enchantress is angered accidentally, she can be pacified by [throwing](/wiki/Throw "Throw") a [candy bar](/wiki/Candy_bar "Candy bar") at her.

Due to her generation method she is not typically a threat, and setting her off is easily avoidable with careful play. However, she does not like Infidels in the slightest: if an Infidel defeats her in Ice Queen form, she will become the Enchantress as normal, but this incurs a -2 alignment penalty and she will *remain* hostile; she will then stand in place for 100 turns, after which she will un-paralyze herself and pursue the character if they have not left in that time frame. This should give an Infidel just enough time to loot the crystal chests, free and [saddle](/wiki/Saddle "Saddle") the trapped [pegasus](/wiki/Pegasus "Pegasus"), retrieve any [eggs](/wiki/Egg "Egg") under it, and beeline for the stairs before they risk meeting death at her hands.

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Frozen](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frozen "wikipedia:Frozen")***

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[White Witch](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/White_Witch "wikipedia:White Witch")***

Kathryn is the daughter of [EvilHack's developer](/wiki/User:K2 "User:K2"), and her companions Bourbon and Ozzy, as well as her former companion [Koa](/wiki/Koa "Koa"), are based on the family's German Shepherd dogs. The Ice Queen is loosely based off of Elsa from the movie *Frozen* - Kathryn was eight years old when work began on the Ice Queen branch, and had watched the movie with her father so many times that the number is too large to be represented here; Elsa was her favorite movie character at the time. As implied by the [encyclopedia](/wiki/Encyclopedia "Encyclopedia") entry, she is also somewhat based on the White Witch, the main antagonist of the *Chronicles of Narnia* books by C. S. Lewis.

## Encyclopedia Entry

"The White Witch? Who is she?"  
"Why, it is she that has got all Narnia under her thumb.  
It's she that makes it always winter. Always winter and  
never Christmas; think of that!"  
"How awful!" said Lucy.  
  
Every moment the patches of green grew bigger and the patches  
of snow grew smaller. Every moment more and more of the trees  
shook off their robes of snow. Soon, wherever you looked,  
instead of white shapes you saw the dark green of firs or the  
black prickly branches of bare oaks and beeches and elms.  
Then the mist turned from white to gold and presently cleared  
away altogether. Shafts of delicious sunlight struck down on  
to the forest floor and overhead you could see a blue sky  
between the tree tops.  
\[ The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe,  
by C.S. Lewis ]
html:
Kathryn the Ice Queen

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Kathryn the Ice Queen, @, is the boss of the Ice Queen's Realm in EvilHack. She is a powerful human sorceress under an evil curse - upon her defeat, the curse is lifted and she becomes the much more powerful and peaceful Kathryn the Enchantress, @. She is unaligned in her Ice Queen form and lawful in her Enchantress form, and is completely unkillable: she cannot be tamed, genocided, or polymorphed into in either form.

Descriptions

@ Kathryn the Ice Queen (No tile)
Difficulty 36
Attacks Weapon 3d4, Touch 8d8 cold, Spell-casting 3d8 clerical, Spell-casting 3d8 mage
@ Kathryn the Ice Queen (No tile)
Difficulty 36
Attacks

Weapon 3d4, Touch 8d8 cold, Spell-casting 3d8 clerical, Spell-casting 3d8 mage

Base level 32
Base experience 1561
Speed 15
Base AC 0
Base MR 80
Alignment A_NONE
Frequency (by normal means) Unique
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size Medium
Resistances petrification, sleep, cold
Resistances conveyed None

Kathryn the Ice Queen:

  • can fly.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • regenerates HP quickly.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is female.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is nasty.
  • is strong.
  • likes gold.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can pick up magical items.
  • has infravision.
  • never leaves a corpse.
Reference EvilHack 0.8.3 - monst.c, line 3302

Kathryn the Ice Queen is strong and possesses enhanced regeneration, flight, teleport control, infravision, and the ability to see invisible. She will also seek out magical items and other objects to pick up.

Kathryn the Ice Queen has a weapon attack, a powerful cold touch attack, and casts one clerical and one mage monster spell during each of her turns. She is capable of casting spells without cooldown, and will never cast the fire bolt, fire pillar or summon insects spells, instead using ice bolt, lightning and vulnerability respectively. Kathryn is more likely to weaken a character's cold resistance with the vulnerability spell; her geyser spell deals cold damage and can destroy potions in the open inventory; and she will also use the summon minion spell to create hostile snow golems.

Kathryn possesses stoning resistance, sleep resistance and cold resistance, and is vulnerable to fire.

Generation

Kathryn the Ice Queen is always found inside her castle on the third and final floor of the branch, and resides within the left inner chambers. She will always generate hostile, and is guarded by Bourbon and Ozzy; they generate peaceful, but will become hostile and protect her once she is attacked.

Kathryn the Ice Queen is always generated with an enchanted, erosion-proofed athame of frost, a pair of gloves, a pair of high boots, an amulet of reflection, a ring of slow digestion, and one of either a cloak of magic resistance or a cloak of displacement. If generated on her birthday, she will generate with roughly 4 times her usual HP and a potion of full healing.

Strategy

In addition to ascension-level gear, the Ice Queen has the full range of monster spells to cast at her disposal, with her spellcasting geared towards a cold-based offense; this includes using the vulnerability spell to weaken resistance to cold in particular. In short, cold resistance is especially important here (as well as for the branch overall), along with acid resistance to blunt the worst damage from her acid blast spells; weakened cold resistance will cause the characters HP to slowly deplete, so unless they are capable of passively out-healing the frost damage, it is best to defeat her quickly. Defeating Kathryn will transform her into her Enchantress form, also pacifying Bourbon and Ozzy if they are still hostile.

One of the quickest means of defeating Kathryn the Ice Queen is to use poisoned weapons and poison-damaging spells, since she lacks poison resistance. Unless a means to pacify her afterward is available (discussed in the other tab), do not use a scroll of stinking cloud for this purpose: this will anger her if the poison clouds defeat her and return her to Enchantress form well before they dissipate. Her weakness to fire can also be exploited by using several blessed fire scrolls or a Skilled-level fireball spell.

@ Kathryn the Enchantress (No tile)
Difficulty 104
Attacks Weapon 10d10, Spell-casting 10d10 (clerical), Spell-casting 10d10
@ Kathryn the Enchantress (No tile)
Difficulty 104
Attacks

Weapon 10d10, Spell-casting 10d10 (clerical), Spell-casting 10d10

Base level 47
Base experience 2856
Speed 9
Base AC 0
Base MR 100
Alignment 15 (lawful)
Frequency (by normal means) Unique
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size Medium
Resistances petrification, sleep, cold, fire, electricity, poison, acid, disintegration, psychic
Resistances conveyed None

Kathryn the Enchantress:

  • can fly.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • regenerates HP quickly.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is female.
  • is normally generated peaceful.
  • is nasty.
  • is strong.
  • likes gold.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can pick up magical items.
  • lets you close unless attacked.
  • has infravision.
  • never leaves a corpse.
Reference EvilHack 0.8.3 - monst.c, line 3315

Kathryn the Enchantress has the same qualities as she does in her previous form, and additionally possesses fire resistance, poison resistance, acid resistance, shock resistance, disintegration resistance, and psychic resistance.

Kathryn the Enchantress has a powerful weapon attack, and casts a powerful clerical monster spell and a powerful mage monster spell during each of her turns.

Generation

Kathryn the Enchantress always appears after her Ice Queen form is defeated, and will be generated peaceful unless the character is an Infidel. She retains whatever inventory she still possesses from her previous form.

Strategy

In this form, Kathryn has almost every resistance available in the game, alongside attacks and spells that can easily cleave through most of an ascension-worthy character's full healing-and-nurse dance-bolstered HP. As such, she is orders of magnitude more difficult than any other monster in the game, and is very difficult to defeat in normal play, immediately resurrecting at full HP if defeated: there is no benefit to attacking her, outside of bragging rights. If Kathryn the Enchantress is angered accidentally, she can be pacified by throwing a candy bar at her.

Due to her generation method she is not typically a threat, and setting her off is easily avoidable with careful play. However, she does not like Infidels in the slightest: if an Infidel defeats her in Ice Queen form, she will become the Enchantress as normal, but this incurs a -2 alignment penalty and she will remain hostile; she will then stand in place for 100 turns, after which she will un-paralyze herself and pursue the character if they have not left in that time frame. This should give an Infidel just enough time to loot the crystal chests, free and saddle the trapped pegasus, retrieve any eggs under it, and beeline for the stairs before they risk meeting death at her hands.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Frozen
Wikipedia has an article about:
White Witch

Kathryn is the daughter of EvilHack's developer, and her companions Bourbon and Ozzy, as well as her former companion Koa, are based on the family's German Shepherd dogs. The Ice Queen is loosely based off of Elsa from the movie Frozen - Kathryn was eight years old when work began on the Ice Queen branch, and had watched the movie with her father so many times that the number is too large to be represented here; Elsa was her favorite movie character at the time. As implied by the encyclopedia entry, she is also somewhat based on the White Witch, the main antagonist of the Chronicles of Narnia books by C. S. Lewis.

Encyclopedia Entry

"The White Witch? Who is she?"
"Why, it is she that has got all Narnia under her thumb.
It's she that makes it always winter. Always winter and
never Christmas; think of that!"
"How awful!" said Lucy.

Every moment the patches of green grew bigger and the patches
of snow grew smaller. Every moment more and more of the trees
shook off their robes of snow. Soon, wherever you looked,
instead of white shapes you saw the dark green of firs or the
black prickly branches of bare oaks and beeches and elms.
Then the mist turned from white to gold and presently cleared
away altogether. Shafts of delicious sunlight struck down on
to the forest floor and overhead you could see a blue sky
between the tree tops.
[ The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe,
by C.S. Lewis ]

rawPage:
'''Kathryn the Ice Queen''', {{brightcyan|@}}, is the boss of the [[Ice Queen's Realm]] in [[EvilHack]]. She is a powerful [[human]] sorceress under an evil curse - upon her defeat, the curse is lifted and she becomes the much more powerful and peaceful '''Kathryn the Enchantress''', {{yellow|@}}. She is unaligned in her Ice Queen form and [[lawful]] in her Enchantress form, and is completely unkillable: she cannot be [[tame]]d, [[genocide]]d, or [[polymorph]]ed into in either form.

==Descriptions==
<simpletabs>
Kathryn the Ice Queen|
{{ monster
 |name=Kathryn the Ice Queen
 |symbol={{brightcyan|@}}
 |difficulty=36
 |level=32
 |experience=1561
 |speed=15
 |AC=0
 |MR=80
 |align=A_NONE
 |frequency=Unique
 |genocidable=No
 |attacks=Weapon 3d4, Touch 8d8 [[cold]], [[monster spell|Spell-casting]] 3d8 clerical, [[monster spell|Spell-casting]] 3d8 mage
 |resistances conveyed=None
 |resistances=petrification, sleep, cold
 |attributes={{attributes|Kathryn the Ice Queen|humanoid=1|regen=1|omnivore=1|see_invis=1|fly=1|tport_cntrl=1|nopoly=1|hostile=1|strong=1|nasty=1|pname=1|female=1|greedy=1|collect=1|magic=1|waitforu=1|infravision=1|accurate=1|m4_vulnerable_fire=1|mh_human=1|nocorpse=1}}
 |size=Medium
 |nutr=400
 |weight=1450
 |reference=[https://github.com/k21971/EvilHack/blob/v0.8.3/src/monst.c#L3302 EvilHack 0.8.3 - monst.c, line 3302]
}}

Kathryn the Ice Queen is [[strong]] and possesses enhanced [[regeneration]], [[flight]], [[teleport control]], [[infravision]], and the ability to [[see invisible]]. She will also seek out [[magical item]]s and other objects to pick up.

Kathryn the Ice Queen has a weapon attack, a powerful [[cold]] touch attack, and casts one clerical and one mage [[monster spell]] during each of her turns. She is capable of casting spells without cooldown, and will never cast the [[fire bolt]], [[fire pillar]] or [[summon insects]] spells, instead using [[ice bolt]], [[Lightning (monster spell)|lightning]] and [[Vulnerability (monster spell)|vulnerability]] respectively. Kathryn is more likely to weaken a character's cold resistance with the vulnerability spell; her [[geyser]] spell deals cold damage and can destroy [[potion]]s in the open inventory; and she will also use the [[summon minion]] spell to create hostile [[snow golem]]s.

Kathryn possesses [[stoning resistance]], [[sleep resistance]] and [[cold resistance]], and is [[vulnerable]] to [[fire]].

===Generation===
Kathryn the Ice Queen is always found inside her castle on the third and final floor of the branch, and resides within the left inner chambers. She will always generate hostile, and is guarded by [[Bourbon]] and [[Ozzy]]; they generate peaceful, but will become hostile and protect her once she is attacked.

Kathryn the Ice Queen is [[monster starting inventory|always generated with]] an enchanted, [[erosion]]-proofed [[athame]] of frost, a [[pair of gloves]], a pair of [[high boots]], an [[amulet of reflection]], a [[ring of slow digestion]], and one of either a [[cloak of magic resistance]] or a [[cloak of displacement]]. If generated on her birthday,<!--February 12th--> she will generate with roughly 4 times her usual HP and a [[potion of full healing]].

===Strategy===
In addition to ascension-level gear, the Ice Queen has the full range of monster spells to cast at her disposal, with her spellcasting geared towards a cold-based offense; this includes using the vulnerability spell to weaken resistance to cold in particular. In short, cold resistance is especially important here (as well as for the branch overall), along with [[acid resistance]] to blunt the worst damage from her acid blast spells; weakened cold resistance will cause the characters HP to slowly deplete, so unless they are capable of passively out-healing the frost damage, it is best to defeat her quickly. Defeating Kathryn will transform her into her Enchantress form, also pacifying Bourbon and Ozzy if they are still hostile.

One of the quickest means of defeating Kathryn the Ice Queen is to use [[poisoned]] weapons and poison-damaging spells, since she lacks poison resistance. Unless a means to pacify her afterward is available (discussed in the other tab), '''do not use a [[scroll of stinking cloud]]''' for this purpose: this will anger her if the [[poison cloud]]s defeat her and return her to Enchantress form well before they dissipate. Her weakness to fire can also be exploited by using several blessed {{? of|fire}} scrolls or a Skilled-level [[fireball]] spell.

|-|
Kathryn the Enchantress|
{{ monster
 |name=Kathryn the Enchantress
 |symbol={{yellow|@}}
 |difficulty=104
 |level=47
 |experience=2856
 |speed=9
 |AC=0
 |MR=100
 |align=15
 |frequency=Unique
 |genocidable=No
 |attacks=Weapon 10d10, [[monster spell|Spell-casting]] 10d10 (clerical), [[monster spell|Spell-casting]] 10d10
 |resistances conveyed=None
 |resistances=petrification, sleep, cold, fire, electricity, poison, acid, disintegration, psychic
 |attributes={{attributes|Kathryn the Enchantress|humanoid=1|regen=1|omnivore=1|see_invis=1|fly=1|tport_cntrl=1|nopoly=1|peaceful=1|strong=1|nasty=1|pname=1|female=1|greedy=1|collect=1|magic=1|close=1|infravision=1|accurate=1|mh_human=1|nocorpse=1}}
 |size=Medium
 |nutr=400
 |weight=1450
 |reference=[https://github.com/k21971/EvilHack/blob/v0.8.3/src/monst.c#L3315 EvilHack 0.8.3 - monst.c, line 3315]
}}

Kathryn the Enchantress has the same qualities as she does in her previous form, and additionally possesses [[fire resistance]], [[poison resistance]], [[acid resistance]], [[shock resistance]], [[disintegration resistance]], and [[psychic resistance]].

Kathryn the Enchantress has a powerful weapon attack, and casts a powerful clerical [[monster spell]] and a powerful mage monster spell during each of her turns.

===Generation===
Kathryn the Enchantress always appears after her Ice Queen form is defeated, and will be generated peaceful unless the character is an [[Infidel]]. She retains whatever inventory she still possesses from her previous form.

===Strategy===
In this form, Kathryn has almost every resistance available in the game, alongside attacks and spells that can easily cleave through most of an ascension-worthy character's {{! of|full healing}}-and-[[nurse dance]]-bolstered HP. As such, she is orders of magnitude more difficult than any other monster in the game, and is very difficult to defeat in normal play, immediately resurrecting at full HP if defeated: there is no benefit to attacking her, outside of bragging rights. If Kathryn the Enchantress is angered accidentally, she can be pacified by [[throw]]ing a [[candy bar]] at her.

Due to her generation method she is not typically a threat, and setting her off is easily avoidable with careful play. However, she does not like Infidels in the slightest: if an Infidel defeats her in Ice Queen form, she will become the Enchantress as normal, but this incurs a -2 alignment penalty and she will ''remain'' hostile; she will then stand in place for 100 turns, after which she will un-paralyze herself and pursue the character if they have not left in that time frame. This should give an Infidel just enough time to loot the crystal chests, free and [[saddle]] the trapped [[pegasus]], retrieve any [[egg]]s under it, and beeline for the stairs before they risk meeting death at her hands.

</simpletabs>
{{clear}}

==Origin==
{{wikipedia|Frozen}}
{{wikipedia|White Witch}}
Kathryn is the daughter of [[User:K2|EvilHack's developer]], and her companions Bourbon and Ozzy, as well as her former companion [[Koa]], are based on the family's German Shepherd dogs. The Ice Queen is loosely based off of Elsa from the movie ''Frozen'' - Kathryn was eight years old when work began on the Ice Queen branch, and had watched the movie with her father so many times that the number is too large to be represented here; Elsa was her favorite movie character at the time. As implied by the [[encyclopedia]] entry, she is also somewhat based on the White Witch, the main antagonist of the ''Chronicles of Narnia'' books by C. S. Lewis.
